comments.text:
I create a new profile using Miramar 3.3 Alpha 3 on Windows 7 (64 bit).

"Mail Account Setup": I enter Your name (Kent James), Email address (kenttest@caspia.com), and Password. Continue

"Looking up configuration ... " various entries

"Configuration found by trying common server names"

"Incoming: IMAP, caspia.com, STARTTLS"
"Outgoing: SMTP, mail.caspia.com, STARTTLS"
"Username: kenttest"

Popup window: "Secure connection failed, caspia.com:993 uses an invalid security certificate ... (Error code: ssl_error_bad_cert_domain)"  I can choose "View Certificate" or "Cancel", I choose "Cancel"

Now I choose "Create Account"

"Checking password"

Popup window: "Add Security Exception ... location caspia.com:143"  I choose Confirm Security Exception.

"Checking password..." again.  After around 10 seconds, mail account wizard window closes, and I get the "System Integration" popup window which is unrelated.

At this point, the inbox for the new account is selected. After a few seconds, I get "login to server caspia.com failed".  When I choose "Enter New Password" it says "Enter your password for kenttest@caspia.com"  It should say "kenttest@caspia.com@caspia.com"

I enter the correct password anyway. It tries again to load the inbox, and fails again, and again I get "Login to server caspia.com failed". This time I Cancel.

Going to Account Settings/kenttest@caspia.com/Server Settings, "User Name" is kenttest, but it should be "kenttest@caspia.com"  Setting it to the correct value, I get a new Mail Server Password Required prompt. Entering the correct password, I can then download email successfully.

I would be happy to setup a test user account for you on this server (which is hosted with a large US internet service provider) if you need it.
comments.creator: rkent@caspia.com
